page.title: 16Hope Hospital (785 989)
page.content: Hope Hospital, on Eccles Old Road, is called after the district in which it is built. It is the largest hospital in the area. It started as a workhouse in 1882, specially built to cope with the destitute, sick and infirm. During the First World War it took wounded soldiers and in 1925 became a General Hospital. It was damaged by bombing during the Second World War but afterwards was expanded greatly. Hope is now a teaching hospital and it has 647 beds and treats over 17000 in-patients a year. You can still see traces of the old workhouse and there are still long brick corridors with high roofs. Like every other hospital, Hope has its problems, mainly through shortage of funds. Patients are even sometimes asked to take blankets in with them and the sheets are thin and mended.
